              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">683,423</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="76%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">Total
                  liabilities, minority interest, and stockholders' equity</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">4,267,236</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>

              </td>

            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        accompanying notes are an integral part of these consolidated balance
        sheets.</font></div><br>

              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">23,485</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td valign="bottom" width="76%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>

      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        accompanying notes are an integral part of these consolidated financial
        statements.</font></div><br>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">

        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">-6-</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div><br>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>THE
        HERSHEY COMPANY</strong></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>NOTES
        TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</strong></font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>1.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;BASIS
        OF PRESENTATION</strong></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Our
        unaudited consolidated financial statements provided in this report include
        the
        accounts of the Company and our majority-owned subsidiaries and entities
        in
        which we have a controlling financial interest after the elimination of
        intercompany accounts and transactions.&#160;&#160;We prepared these statements
        in accordance with the instructions to Form&#160;10-Q.&#160;&#160;These
        statements do not include all of the information and footnotes required by
        U.S.
        generally accepted accounting principles for complete financial
        statements.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">We
        included all adjustments (consisting only of normal recurring accruals) which
        we
        believe were considered necessary for a fair presentation. We reclassified
        certain prior year amounts to conform to the 2007
        presentation.&#160;&#160;Operating results for the six months ended July 1, 2007
        may not be indicative of the results that may be expected for the year ending
        December&#160;31,&#160;2007, because of the seasonal effects of our
        business.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Items
        Affecting Comparability</strong></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Securities
        and Exchange Commission Staff Accounting Bulletin No. 108, <em>Considering the
        Effects of Prior Misstatements When Quantifying Misstatements in Current
        Year
        Financial Statements </em>(&#8220;SAB No. 108&#8221;), required companies to change the
        accounting principle used for evaluating the effect of possible prior year
        misstatements when quantifying misstatements in current year financial
        statements. As a result, at December 31, 2006 we changed one of the five
        criteria of our revenue recognition policy, resulting in a delay in the
        recognition of revenue on goods in-transit until they are received by our
        customers. As permitted by SAB No. 108, we adjusted our financial statements
        for
        the three-month and six-month periods ended July 2, 2006 to provide
        comparability. These adjustments were not material to our results of operations
        for those periods. For more information, refer to the consolidated financial
        statements and notes included in our 2006 Annual Report on Form
        10-K.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>2.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;BUSINESS
        ACQUISITIONS</strong></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
        May
        2007, our Company and Godrej Beverages and Foods, Ltd., one of India&#8217;s largest
        consumer goods, confectionery and food companies, entered into an agreement
        to
        manufacture and distribute confectionery products, snacks and beverages across
        India.&#160;&#160;Under the agreement, we invested $58.7 million during the
        second quarter and own a 51% controlling interest. Total liabilities assumed
        were $59.0 million. Effective in May 2007, this business acquisition was
        included in our consolidated results.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Also
        in
        May 2007, our Company and Lotte Confectionery Co., LTD., entered into a
        manufacturing agreement in China that will produce Hershey products and certain
        Lotte products for the market in China.&#160;&#160;We invested $18.3 million in
        the second quarter of 2007 and own a 44% interest.&#160;&#160;We will account
        for this investment under the equity method.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Under
        each of the acquisition agreements, our Company and the other parties are
        currently obligated to make additional investments.&#160;&#160;We expect to
        invest a total of approximately $23.8 million later this year in these
        businesses.&#160;&#160;The additional investments will not change our ownership
        interests.</font></div><br>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">-7-</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">

        </div>
      </div><br>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>3.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;STOCK
        COMPENSATION PLANS</strong></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">At
        our
        annual meeting of stockholders, held April 17, 2007, stockholders approved
        The
        Hershey Company Equity and Incentive Compensation Plan (&#8220;EICP&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The
        EICP is an amendment and restatement of our former Key Employee Incentive
        Plan,
        a share-based employee incentive compensation plan, and is also a continuation
        of our Broad Based Stock Option Plan, Broad Based Annual Incentive Plan and
        Directors&#8217; Compensation Plan.&#160;&#160;Following its adoption on April 17,
        2007, the EICP became the single plan under which grants using shares for
        compensation and incentive purposes will be made.&#160;&#160;The following table
        summarizes our stock compensation costs:</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div><br></div>

            <tr>

                  the Three </strong></font></div>
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>Months
                  Ended</strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="bottom" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>

                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>Months

                  1, </strong></font></div>
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>2007</strong></font></div>

              <td valign="bottom" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>

                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>July
                  2, </strong></font></div>
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>2006</strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="bottom" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="7%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>July
                  1, </strong></font></div>
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>2007</strong></font></div>

              <td valign="top" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>

            <tr>
              <td valign="top" width="38%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>

      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        decrease in share-based compensation expense from 2006 to 2007 was primarily
        associated with lower performance expectations for the PSUs and the timing
        of
        stock option grants in 2007.&#160;&#160;The 2007 stock option grants were
        delayed pending approval by our stockholders of the EICP at the annual meeting
        in April 2007.</font></div>

                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;
                  8,691,849&#160;</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$37.11</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="bottom" width="12%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">5.3
                  years</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>

      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">As
        of
        July 1, 2007, there was $16.5 million of unrecognized compensation cost relating
        to non-vested performance stock units and restricted stock units.&#160;&#160;We
        expect to recognize that cost over a weighted-average period of 2.6
        years.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>

        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="93%">

            <tr>
              <td valign="bottom" width="60%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td colspan="3" valign="top" width="21%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>For
                  the Six Months Ended</strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td width="16%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td valign="bottom" width="60%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="7%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>July
                  1, </strong></font></div>
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>2007</strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="7%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="7%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>July
                  2,</strong></font></div>
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>2006</strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td width="16%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="60%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">Intrinsic
                  value of share-based liabilities paid, combined with the fair
</font></div>
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">value
                  of shares vested (in millions of dollars)</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="7%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$&#160;&#160;21.0</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="bottom" width="7%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="7%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$&#160;&#160;3.7</font></div>
              </td>
              <td width="16%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        lower
        amount in 2006 was primarily associated with the additional three-year vesting
        term for performance stock unit grants for the 2003-2005 performance cycle
        (&#8220;2003 grants&#8221;) which reduced the number of shares that vested in 2006 compared
        with 2007.&#160;&#160;An additional three-year vesting term was imposed on the
        grant date for the 2003 grants with accelerated vesting for retirement,
        disability or death.&#160;&#160;The compensation cost based on grant date fair
        value for the 2003 grants is being recognized over a period from three to
        six
        years.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Deferred
        performance stock units, deferred restricted stock units,&#160;and directors&#8217;
fees and accumulated dividend amounts representing deferred stock units totaled
        725,705 units as of July 1, 2007. Each unit is equivalent to one share of
        the
        Company's Common Stock.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">No
        stock
        appreciation rights were outstanding as of July 1, 2007.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">For
        more
        information on our stock compensation plans, refer to the consolidated financial
        statements and notes included in our 2006 Annual Report on Form 10-K and
        our
        proxy statement for the 2007 annual meeting of stockholders.</font></div><br>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">

        EXPENSE</strong></font></div>

        interest expense consisted of the following:</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font size="2"><br></font>

                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="50%">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">Interest

                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="50%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px">

                    expense, net</font></div>

                <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">57,468</font></div>
                </td>

                <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">52,693</font></div>
                </td>
                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="27%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>

          </table>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">For
        the
        first six months of 2007, net interest expense was higher than the comparable
        period of 2006, primarily due to the financing of share
        repurchases.&#160;&#160;Higher interest rates in 2007 as compared with 2006 also
        contributed to the increase in net interest expense.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>5.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;BUSINESS
        REALIGNMENT INITIATIVES</strong></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
        February 2007, we announced a comprehensive, three-year supply chain
        transformation program (the &#8220;2007 business realignment
        initiatives&#8221;).&#160;&#160;When completed, this program will greatly enhance our
        manufacturing, sourcing and customer service capabilities, reduce inventories
        resulting in improvements in working capital and generate significant resources
        to invest in our growth initiatives.&#160;&#160;These initiatives include
        accelerated marketplace momentum within our core U.S. business, creation
        of
        innovative new product platforms to meet customer needs and disciplined global
        expansion.&#160;&#160;Under the program, which will be implemented in stages
        over the next three years, we will significantly increase manufacturing capacity
        utilization by reducing the number of production lines by more than one-third,
        outsource production of low value-added items and construct a flexible,
        cost-effective production facility in Monterrey, Mexico to meet current and
        emerging marketplace needs.&#160;&#160;The program will result in a total net
        reduction of 1,500 positions across our supply chain over the next three
        years.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        estimated pre-tax cost of the program is from $525 million to $575 million
        over
        the next three years.&#160;&#160;The total includes from $475 million to $525
        million in business realignment costs and approximately $50 million in project
        implementation costs.&#160;&#160;The costs will be incurred primarily in 2007
        and 2008, with approximately $270 million to $300 million expected in
        2007.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
        July
        2005, we announced initiatives intended to advance our value-enhancing strategy
        (the &#8220;2005 business realignment initiatives&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Charges for the 2005
        business realignment initiatives were recorded during 2005 and 2006 and the
        2005
        business realignment initiatives were completed by December 31,
        2006.</font></div><br>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">-10-</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div><br>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Charges
        (credits) associated with business realignment initiatives recorded during
        the
        three-month and six-month periods ended July 1, 2007 and July 2, 2006 were
        as
        follows:</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
      <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="93%">

            <tr>
              <td valign="bottom" width="52%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td colspan="6" valign="bottom" width="22%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>For
                  the Three</strong></font></div>
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>Months
                  Ended</strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td colspan="6" valign="bottom" width="22%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">

                <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">4,372</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        charge of $41.3 million recorded in cost of sales during the second quarter
        of
        2007 for the 2007 business realignment initiatives related to the accelerated
        depreciation of fixed assets over a reduced estimated remaining useful life
        and
        costs related to inventory reductions.&#160;&#160;The $3.3 million recorded in
        selling, marketing and administrative expenses related primarily to project
        administration.&#160;&#160;In determining the costs related to fixed asset
        impairments, fair value was estimated based on the expected sales
        proceeds.&#160;&#160;Certain real estate with a net realizable value of $5.4
        million was being held for sale as of July 1, 2007.&#160;&#160;The employee
        separation costs included $22.3 million for involuntary terminations at six
        North American manufacturing facilities which are being closed.&#160;&#160;The
        facilities are located in Naugatuck, Connecticut; Reading, Pennsylvania;
        Oakdale, California; Smiths Falls, Ontario; Montreal, Quebec; and Dartmouth,
        Nova Scotia.&#160;&#160;The employee separation costs also included $29.2
        million for charges relating to pension and other post-retirement benefits
        curtailments and special termination benefits.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Charges
        (credits) associated with previous business realignment initiatives which
        began
        in 2003 and 2001 resulted from the finalization of the sale of certain
        properties, adjustments to liabilities which had previously been recorded,
        and
        the impact of the settlement as to several of the eight former employees
        who had
        filed a complaint alleging that the Company had discriminated against them
        on
        the basis of age in connection with the 2003 business realignment
        initiatives.&#160;&#160;The $3.7 million charge associated with the 2005
        business realignment initiatives was related primarily to the U.S. Voluntary
        Workforce Reduction Program (&#8220;VWRP&#8221;), in addition to costs for streamlining the
        Company&#8217;s international operations and facility rationalization relating to the
        closure of the Las Piedras, Puerto Rico plant.&#160;&#160;The business
        realignment charge included $2.1 million for involuntary
        terminations.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        charge of $51.2 million recorded in cost of sales during the first six months
        of
        2007 for the 2007 business realignment initiatives related to the accelerated
        depreciation of fixed assets over a reduced estimated remaining useful life
        and
        costs related to inventory reductions.&#160;&#160;The $6.3 million recorded in
        selling, marketing and administrative expenses related primarily to project
        administration.&#160;&#160;In determining the costs related to fixed asset
        impairments, fair value was estimated based on the expected sales
        proceeds.&#160;&#160;The employee separation costs</font></div><br>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">-11-</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div><br>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">included
        $23.7&#160;million for involuntary terminations and $29.2 million for charges
        relating to pension and other post-retirement benefits curtailments and special
        termination benefits.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">A
        credit
        of $1.6 million recorded in cost of sales for the 2005 business realignment
        initiatives related to higher than expected proceeds from the sale of equipment
        from the Las Piedras plant.&#160;&#160;The $7.1&#160;million charge associated
        with the 2005 business realignment initiatives related primarily to the U.S.
        VWRP, along with costs for streamlining the Company&#8217;s international operations
        and facility rationalization relating to the closure of the Las Piedras
        plant.&#160;&#160;The business realignment charge included $2.9 million for
        involuntary terminations.&#160;&#160;Charges (credits) associated with previous
        business realignment initiatives which began in 2003 and 2001 resulted from
        the
        finalization of the sale of certain properties, adjustments to liabilities
        which
        had previously been recorded, and the impact of the settlement as to several
        of
        the eight former employees who had filed a complaint alleging that the Company
        had discriminated against them on the basis of age in connection with the
        2003
        business realignment initiatives.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        July
        1, 2007 liability balance relating to the 2007 business realignment initiatives
        was $23.5 million for employee separation costs.&#160;&#160;The July 1, 2007
        liability balance relating to the 2005 business realignment initiatives was
        $8.7
        million.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>6.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;EARNINGS
        PER SHARE</strong></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
        accordance with Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 128,
<em>Earnings Per Share,</em> we compute Basic and Diluted Earnings Per Share
        based on the weighted-average number of shares of the Common Stock and the
        Class
        B Common Stock outstanding as follows:</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>

              <td valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>

                <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">.91</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        Class
        B Common Stock is convertible into Common Stock on a share for share basis
        at
        any time. In accordance with proposed Financial Accounting Standards Board
        (&#8220;FASB&#8221;) Staff Position No. FAS 128-a, <em>Computational Guidance for Computing
        Diluted EPS under the Two-Class Method, </em>the calculation of earnings per
        share-diluted for the Class B Common Stock was performed using the two-class
        method and the calculation of earnings per share-diluted for the Common Stock
        was performed using the if-converted method.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">For
        the
        three-month and six-month periods ended July 1, 2007, 5.6 million stock options
        were not included in the diluted earnings per share calculation because the
        effect would have been antidilutive. In the second quarter and</font></div><br>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">-12-</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div><br>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">first
        six
        months of 2006, 3.6&#160;million stock options were not included in the diluted
        earnings per share calculation because the effect would have been
        antidilutive.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>7.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;DERIVATIVE
        INSTRUMENTS AND HEDGING ACTIVITIES</strong></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">We
        account for derivative instruments in accordance with Statement of Financial
        Accounting Standards No.&#160;133, <em>Accounting for Derivative Instruments and
        Hedging Activities,</em> as amended (&#8220;SFAS No. 133, as
        amended&#8221;).&#160;&#160;SFAS No. 133, as amended, requires us to recognize all
        derivative instruments at fair value. We classify the derivatives as assets
        or
        liabilities on the balance sheet. As of July 1, 2007 and July 2, 2006, all
        of
        our derivative instruments were classified as cash flow hedges.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Summary
        of Activity</strong></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Our
        cash
        flow hedging derivative activity during the three months and six months ended
        July 1, 2007 and July&#160;2, 2006 was as follows:</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font size="2"><br>&#160;</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">

                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>For
                    the Three Months </strong></font></div>
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>Ended</strong></font></div>

      <div><br></div>
      <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="93%">

            <tr>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: symbol, serif;"><strong>&#183;</strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="97%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">Net
                  gains and losses on cash flow hedging derivatives were primarily
                  associated with commodities futures contracts.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="97%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: symbol, serif;"><strong>&#183;</strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="97%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">Reclassification
                  adjustments from accumulated other comprehensive income (loss)
                  to income
                  related to gains or losses on commodities futures contracts and
                  were
                  reflected in cost of sales.&#160;&#160;Reclassification adjustments for
                  gains on interest rate swaps were reflected as an adjustment to
                  interest
                  expense.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>

            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: symbol, serif;"><strong>&#183;</strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="97%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">We
                  recognized no components of gains or losses on cash flow hedging
                  derivatives in income due to excluding such components from the
                  hedge
                  effectiveness assessment.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        amount of net gains on cash flow hedging derivatives, including foreign exchange
        forward contracts, interest rate swap agreements and commodities futures
        contracts, expected to be reclassified into earnings in the next twelve months
        was approximately $1.4 million after tax as of July 1, 2007. This amount
        was
        primarily associated with foreign exchange forward contracts.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
        February 2006, we terminated a forward swap agreement hedging the anticipated
        execution of $250&#160;million of term financing because the transaction was no
        longer expected to occur by the originally specified time period or within
        an
        additional two-month period of time thereafter.&#160;&#160;A gain of
        $1.0&#160;million was recorded in the first quarter of 2006 as a result of the
        discontinuance of this cash flow hedge.&#160;&#160;No other gains or losses on
        cash flow hedging derivatives were reclassified from accumulated other
        comprehensive income (loss) into income as a result of the discontinuance
        of a
        hedge because it became probable that a hedged forecasted transaction would
        not
        occur.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">For
        more
        information, refer to the consolidated financial statements and notes included
        in our 2006 Annual Report on Form 10-K.</font></div><br>

        INCOME</strong></font></div>

        summary
        of the components of comprehensive income (loss) is as follows:</font></div>

                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>Tax
                  </strong></font></div>
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>(Expense)
                  Benefit</strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>

              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="50%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px">

                  income</font></div>

        </table>

              </td>

            </tr>

              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="11%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">(138,189</font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="10%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">)</font></td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Effective
        December 31, 2006, we adopted Statement of Financial Accounting Standards
        No.
        158, <em>Employers&#8217; Accounting for Defined Benefit Pension and Other
        Postretirement Plans, </em>an amendment of FASB Statements No.&#160;87, 88, 106,
        and 132 (R) (&#8220;SFAS No. 158&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The provisions of SFAS No. 158 require
        that the funded status of our pension plans and the benefit obligations of
        our
        post-retirement benefit plans be recognized in our balance
        sheet.&#160;&#160;Appropriate adjustments were made to various assets and
        liabilities as of December 31, 2006, with an offsetting after-tax effect
        of
        $138.0 million recorded as a component of other comprehensive income rather
        than
        as an adjustment to the ending balance of accumulated other comprehensive
        loss.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Excluding
        the impact of the adoption of SFAS No. 158, total other comprehensive income
        for
        the year ended December 31, 2006 was $9.1 million after-tax, compared with
        the
        reported other comprehensive loss of $128.9 million after-tax.&#160;&#160;The
        presentation of other comprehensive income for the year ended December 31,
        2006
        will be adjusted to exclude the impact of the adoption of SFAS No. 158 in
        our
        Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ending December 31, 2007.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>9.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;INVENTORIES</strong></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">We
        value
        the majority of our inventories under the last-in, first-out (&#8220;LIFO&#8221;) method and
        the remaining inventories at the lower of first-in, first-out (&#8220;FIFO&#8221;) cost or
        market. Inventories were as follows:</font></div>
      <div><br></div>

              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="11%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">813,836</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="11%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">648,820</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="10%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div><br></div><br>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">-15-</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div><br>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        increase in raw material inventories as of July 1, 2007 resulted from the
        timing
        of deliveries to support manufacturing requirements, reflecting the seasonality
        of our business, and higher costs in 2007. The increase in finished goods
        inventories was primarily associated with seasonal sales patterns and the
        introduction of new products.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>10.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;SHORT-TERM
        DEBT</strong></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">As
        a
        source of short-term financing, we utilize commercial paper or bank loans
        with
        an original maturity of three months or less. In December 2006, we entered
        into
        a new five-year unsecured revolving credit agreement. The credit limit is
        $1.1
        billion with an option to borrow an additional $400 million with the concurrence
        of the lenders. These funds may be used for general corporate
        purposes.&#160;&#160;This unsecured revolving credit agreement contains certain
        financial covenants and customary representations and warranties, and events
        of
        default. As of July 1, 2007 we complied with all covenants pertaining to
        our
        credit agreement. There were no significant compensating balance agreements
        that
        legally restricted these funds. For more information, refer to the consolidated
        financial statements and notes included in our 2006 Annual Report on Form
        10-K.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>11.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;LONG-TERM
        DEBT</strong></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
        May
        2006, we filed a shelf registration statement on Form S-3 that registered
        an
        indeterminate amount of debt securities. This registration statement was
        effective immediately upon filing under Securities and Exchange Commission
        regulations governing &#8220;well-known seasoned issuers&#8221; (the "WKSI Registration
        Statement"). In August 2006, we issued $500&#160;million of Notes under the WKSI
        Registration Statement.&#160;&#160;Proceeds from the debt issuances and any
        other offerings under the WKSI Registration Statement may be used for general
        corporate requirements. These may include reducing existing borrowings,
        financing capital additions, funding contributions to our pension plans,
        future
        business acquisitions and working capital requirements.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>12.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;FINANCIAL
        INSTRUMENTS</strong></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        carrying amounts of financial instruments including cash and cash equivalents,
        accounts receivable, accounts payable and short-term debt approximated fair
        value as of July 1, 2007 and December 31, 2006, because of the relatively
        short
        maturity of these instruments.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        carrying value of long-term debt, including the current portion, was
        $1,287.2&#160;million as of July 1, 2007, compared with a fair value of
        $1,327.3&#160;million, an increase of $40.1 million over the carrying value,
        based on quoted market prices for the same or similar debt issues.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Foreign
        Exchange Forward Contracts</strong></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

        following table summarizes our foreign exchange activity:</font></div>

      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Our
        foreign exchange forward contracts mature in 2007 and 2008.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">We
        define
        the fair value of foreign exchange forward contracts as the amount of the
        difference between contracted and current market foreign currency exchange
        rates
        at the end of the period. On a quarterly basis, we estimate the fair value
        of
        foreign exchange forward contracts by obtaining market quotes for future
        contracts with</font></div><br>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">-16-</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>

      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">similar
        terms, adjusted where necessary for maturity differences. We do not hold
        or
        issue financial instruments for trading purposes.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        total
        fair value of our foreign exchange forward contracts included in prepaid
        expenses and other current assets and in other non-current assets, as
        appropriate, on the Consolidated Balance Sheets were as follows:</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

                  1, </strong></font></div>
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>2007</strong></font></div>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>13.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;INCOME
        TAXES</strong></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
        June
        2006, the FASB issued FASB Interpretation No. 48, <em>Accounting for Uncertainty
        in Income Taxes, an interpretation of FASB Statement No. 109 </em>(&#8220;FIN No.
        48&#8221;). FIN No. 48 clarifies the accounting for uncertainty in income taxes
        recognized in an enterprise&#8217;s financial statements in accordance with Statement
        of Financial Accounting Standards No.&#160;109, <em>Accounting for Income Taxes.
</em>FIN No. 48 describes a recognition threshold and measurement attribute
        for
        the financial statement recognition and measurement of a tax position taken
        or
        expected to be taken in a tax return and also provides guidance on
        derecognition, classification, interest and penalties, accounting in interim
        periods, disclosure and transition.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">We
        adopted the provisions of FIN No. 48 as of January 1, 2007.&#160;&#160;The
        adoption of FIN No. 48 did not result in a significant change to the liability
        for unrecognized tax benefits.&#160;&#160;Upon adoption, we had unrecognized tax
        benefits of $79.0 million of which $45.5 million would impact the effective
        income tax rate if recognized.&#160;&#160;The entire amount of unrecognized tax
        benefits was classified as other long-term liabilities on the balance sheet
        since we do not expect to make any payments to taxing authorities related
        to
        such tax positions in the next twelve months.&#160;&#160;We report accrued
        interest and penalties related to unrecognized tax benefits in income tax
        expense.&#160;&#160;Upon adoption, we had accruals of approximately $17.4
        million for the payment of interest and penalties.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">We
        file
        income tax returns in the U.S. federal jurisdiction and various state and
        foreign jurisdictions.&#160;&#160;A number of years may elapse before an
        uncertain tax position, for which we have unrecognized tax benefits, is audited
        and finally resolved. While it is often difficult to predict the final outcome
        or the timing of resolution of any particular uncertain tax position, we
        believe
        that our unrecognized tax benefits reflect the most likely
        outcome.&#160;&#160;We adjust these unrecognized tax benefits, as well as the
        related interest, in light of changing facts and circumstances. Settlement
        of
        any particular position would usually require the use of
        cash.&#160;&#160;Favorable resolution would be recognized as a reduction to our
        effective income tax rate in the period of resolution.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        number of years with open tax audits varies depending on the tax
        jurisdiction.&#160;&#160;Our major taxing jurisdictions include the United
        States (federal and state) and Canada.&#160;&#160;We are no longer subject to
        U.S. federal examinations by the Internal Revenue Service (&#8220;IRS&#8221;) for years
        before 2004 and various tax examinations by state taxing authorities could
        be
        conducted for years beginning in 2000.&#160;&#160;We are no longer subject to
        Canadian federal income tax examinations by the Canada Revenue Agency (&#8220;CRA&#8221;)
        for years before 1999. U.S. and Canadian federal audit issues typically involve
        the timing of deductions and transfer pricing adjustments.&#160;&#160;We work
        with the IRS and the CRA to resolve proposed audit adjustments and to minimize
        the amount of adjustments.&#160;&#160;We do not anticipate that any potential
        tax adjustments will have a significant impact on our financial position
        or
        results of operations.</font></div><br>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">-17-</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div><br>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>14.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;PENSION
        AND OTHER POST-RETIREMENT BENEFIT PLANS</strong></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Components
        of net periodic benefits (income) cost consisted of the following:</font></div>
      <div><br></div>

                  return on plan assets</font></div>
              </td>
